oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview with Brenda Lee - 2003-12-19
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Brenda Lee from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 19, 2003.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Brenda Lee;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience. Interview with Brenda Lee conducted by Jay Orr . Includes audio from video and recorded audio. Subject matter includes; CMHOF&M membership appeal -- First recordings in 1956 -- Paul Cohen and Owen Bradley -- her confidence as a young singer -- working with Nashville session musicians -- Shel Silverstein demonstration recordings -- rockabilly vocal stylings -- First Christmas song recordings -- Elvis Presley visiting the Grand Ole Opry and photograph made with Brenda -- Elvis' marriage to Priscilla -- Getting the Little Miss Dynamite nickname -- Popularity in England -- Recording of the song Rockin' Around The Christmas Tree -- Johnny Marks stories -- Owen Bradley and team work in the recording studio -- Rockin' Around The Christmas Tree stories -- The song Sweet Nothings and song writer Ronnie Self -- The Owen Bradley and Brenda Lee team -- Appearing on Ozark Jubilee television show as a child -- The recording of I'm Sorry and Owen Bradley's first session with strings -- Introduction of husband Ronnie Shacklett -- Record labels hesitation to release I'm Sorry -- Questions from the audience -- The song All Alone Am I coming from Greece -- Overseas tours -- Problems with having success at a young age -- success in other countries -- Hearing herself on the radio.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Lee, Brenda, 1944-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Rockin Around
